New Records: Pakistan scored 286 runs in their innings, the highest by any team in the match
Saud Shakeel scored 76 runs, his first century in ODIs
Mohammad Rizwan scored 53 runs, his second half-century in the match
Haris Rauf took 3 wickets for 34 runs, his best bowling performance in ODIs
Key Match Events: The Netherlands collapsed from 205/4 to 205 all out, losing 8 wickets for 85 runs
Bas de Leede scored 67 runs, his highest score in ODIs
Rauf took a crucial wicket of Logan van Beek to secure the win for Pakistan
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of improving powerplay performance
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards felt the match was winnable but credited Pakistan's quality bowling
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam praised the team's resilience and the support from the Hyderabad crowd
Scott Edwards expressed disappointment but acknowledged Pakistan's strong performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's win boosted their net run rate, which was crucial for their World Cup campaign
The match was Pakistan's opening game in the World Cup
The Netherlands faced a tough fixture schedule following the match
Others: The match was played at the World Cup 2023 in Hyderabad, India
The article provided detailed live updates and post-match analysis
